section.title: Authentication Response
section.para: In response to valid credentials, this service returns an authentication token and a service catalog with the endpoints that you use to request services.
Do not include explicit API endpoints in your scripts and applications. Instead, find the endpoint for your service and use it.
The following output shows a partial authentication response in JSON format. Authenticate: JSON Response

The authentication response contains the following elements:
<serviceCatalog> - a list of services
The number and type of services vary by account. Service objects include the following elements:
<name - the service name
<type - the OpenStack service type
<endpoints - the list of service endpoints
<token> - the token and details about the token
<user> - details about the user who requested authentication
Successful authentication returns the following information:

callout.para: The name of the service appears in the name field of the unnamed service object within the serviceCatalog element.
Locate the correct service name in the service catalog. For example, the service name for Cloud Images is cloudImages.
Endpoints for requesting Rackspace Cloud services appear in the endpoints element in the unnamed service object within the serviceCatalog element.
Endpoint information includes the public URL, region, tenant ID, and version information.
Multiple endpoints might be shown to enable regional choice.Â Select the appropriate endpoint for the region that you want to interact with by examining the region field.
The public URL for the service appears in the publicURL element in the endpoints element. Use this element to access the chosen service.
To access the &CImS;, include the publicURL value for the cloudImages for your chosen endpoint.
The expiration date and time for the authentication token appear in the expires field in the token element. After this date and time, the token is no longer valid.
This field shows the maximum lifespan for a token, but a token could be manually revoked before it reaches the maximum lifespan.
Clients are encouraged to cache a token until it expires.

note.para: Because the authentication token expires after 24 hours, you must generate a token once a day.

callout.para: The authentication token appears in the id field in the token element.
You pass the authentication token in the X-Auth-Token header each time that you send a request to a service.

section.para: For example, to list images for the IAD endpoint, export the publicURL to the images_url environment variable, and export the authentication token to the token environment variable. Finally, issue a cURL command.
section.programlisting: $ export images_url="https://iad.images.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2" $ export token="abcd123abcd1234567a01b2cdefe3a45" $ curl -s $url/images \-H "X-Auth-Token: $token" | python -m json.tool
